member.name: T:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.EventMessage
member.summary: Event from controller to host

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.DataFrameType.REQ
member.summary: Request. This type MUST be used for unsolicited messages. API callback messages MUST use the Request type.

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.DataFrameType.RES
member.summary: Response. This type MUST be used for messages that are responses to Requests.

member.name: T:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.Frame
member.summary: Base class for all frame types

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.Frame.ACK
member.summary: The ACK frame indicates that the receiving end received a valid Data frame

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.Frame.NAK
member.summary: The NAK frame indicates that the receiving end received a Data frame with errors

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.Frame.CAN
member.summary: The CAN frame indicates that the receiving end discarded an otherwise valid Data frame. The CAN frame is used to resolve race conditions, where both ends send a Data frame and subsequently expects an ACK frame from the other end

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.Frame.SOF
member.summary: The SOF frame contains the Serial API command including parameters for the command in question

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.Frame.Header
member.summary: The header of the frame

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.FrameHeader.SOF
member.summary: The SOF frame contains the Serial API command including parameters for the command in question

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.FrameHeader.ACK
member.summary: The ACK frame indicates that the receiving end received a valid Data frame

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.FrameHeader.NAK
member.summary: The NAK frame indicates that the receiving end received a Data frame with errors

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.Frames.FrameHeader.CAN
member.summary: The CAN frame indicates that the receiving end discarded an otherwise valid Data frame. The CAN frame is used to resolve race conditions, where both ends send a Data frame and subsequently expects an ACK frame from the other end

member.name: T:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.RequestMessage
member.summary: Message from host to controller

member.name: T:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.ResponseMessage
member.summary: Response from controller to host

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.TransmissionState.CompleteOK
member.summary: Successfully

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.TransmissionState.CompleteNoAcknowledge
member.summary: No acknowledge is received before timeout from the destination node. Acknowledge is discarded in case it is received after the timeout.

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.TransmissionState.CompleteFail
member.summary: Not possible to transmit data because the Z-Wave network is busy (jammed).

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.TransmissionState.CompleteNoRoute
member.summary: no route found in Assign Route

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.TransmissionState.NoAcknowledge
member.summary: No Communication ACK received

member.name: F:ZWave4Net.Channel.Protocol.TransmissionState.ResMissing
member.summary: No response received

member.name: T:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.IAssociation
member.summary: The Association interface is used to manage associations to NodeID destinations. A NodeID destination may be a simple device or the Root Device of a Multi Channel device.

member.name: M:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.IAssociation.Get(System.Byte,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Request the current destinations of a given association group.
member.param: This field is used to specify the actual association group. Grouping Identifiers MUST be assigned in a consecutive range starting from 1.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is None.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation

member.name: M:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.IAssociation.GetGroupings(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This command is used to request the number of association groups that this node supports.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is None.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation

member.name: M:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.IAssociation.Remove(System.Byte,System.Byte[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This command is used to remove destinations from a given association group.
member.param: This field is used to specify from which association group the specified NodeID destinations should be removed.
This field is used to specify from which association group the specified NodeID destinations should be removed.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is None.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation

member.name: M:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.IAssociation.Set(System.Byte,System.Byte[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This command is used to add destinations to a given association group.
member.param: This field is used to specify the actual association group. Grouping Identifiers MUST be assigned in a consecutive range starting from 1.
This field specifies a list of NodeIDs that are to be added to the specified association group
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is None.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation

member.name: T:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.IBasic
member.summary: The IBasic interface allows a controlling device to operate the primary functionality of a supporting device without any further knowledge.

member.name: M:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.IBasic.Get(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Request the status of a supporting device
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is None.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation

member.name: M:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.IBasic.Set(System.Byte,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Set a value in a supporting device.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is None.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation

member.name: P:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.IBasic.Reports
member.summary: Advertises the status of the primary functionality of the device

member.name: T:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.ISwitchBinary
member.summary: The Binary Switch interface is used to control devices with On/Off or Enable/Disable capability

member.name: M:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.ISwitchBinary.Get(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The Get command is used to request the status of a device with On/Off or Enable/Disable capability
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is None.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation

member.name: M:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.ISwitchBinary.Set(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The Set command is used to set a value
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is None.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation

member.name: P:ZWave4Net.CommandClasses.ISwitchBinary.Reports
member.summary: Advertises the status of a device with On/Off or Enable/Disable capability.
